specJson.name: brightics.function.statistics$pairplot
specJson.description:
The pairplot visualizes the distribution of single variable and relationships between two variables. During the process of Exploratory Data Analysis(EDA), a pairplot helps us to find patterns, relationships, or anomalies to inform our subsequent analysis.

Reference
+ <https://seaborn.pydata.org/generated/seaborn.pairplot.html>

params.label: X Columns
params.description: Columns to use for the columns of the figure.

params.label: Y Columns
params.description: Columns to use for the rows of the figure. If not specified, `X Columns` are chosen by default.

params.label: Off Diagonal
params.description: Kind of plot for the non-identity relationships.

params.label: Diagonal
params.description: Kind of plot for the diagonal subplots.

params.label: Color By
params.description: Columns to map plot aspects to different colors.

params.label: Markers
params.description: Either the marker to use for all datapoints or a list of markers with a length the same as the number of levels in the hue variable so that differently colored points will also have different scatterplot markers.

params.label: Palette
params.description: Set of colors for mapping the `Color By` variable. Possible values are: Accent, Accent_r, Blues, Blues_r, BrBG, BrBG_r, BuGn, BuGn_r, BuPu, BuPu_r, CMRmap, CMRmap_r, Dark2, Dark2_r, GnBu, GnBu_r, Greens, Greens_r, Greys, Greys_r, OrRd, OrRd_r, Oranges, Oranges_r, PRGn, PRGn_r, Paired, Paired_r, Pastel1, Pastel1_r, Pastel2, Pastel2_r, PiYG, PiYG_r, PuBu, PuBuGn, PuBuGn_r, PuBu_r, PuOr, PuOr_r, PuRd, PuRd_r, Purples, Purples_r, RdBu, RdBu_r, RdGy, RdGy_r, RdPu, RdPu_r, RdYlBu, RdYlBu_r, RdYlGn, RdYlGn_r, Reds, Reds_r, Set1, Set1_r, Set2, Set2_r, Set3, Set3_r, Spectral, Spectral_r, Vega10, Vega10_r, Vega20, Vega20_r, Vega20b, Vega20b_r, Vega20c, Vega20c_r, Wistia, Wistia_r, YlGn, YlGnBu, YlGnBu_r, YlGn_r, YlOrBr, YlOrBr_r, YlOrRd, YlOrRd_r, afmhot, afmhot_r, autumn, autumn_r, binary, binary_r, bone, bone_r, brg, brg_r, bwr, bwr_r, cool, cool_r, coolwarm, coolwarm_r, copper, copper_r, cubehelix, cubehelix_r, flag, flag_r, gist_earth, gist_earth_r, gist_gray, gist_gray_r, gist_heat, gist_heat_r, gist_ncar, gist_ncar_r, gist_rainbow, gist_rainbow_r, gist_stern, gist_stern_r, gist_yarg, gist_yarg_r, gnuplot, gnuplot2, gnuplot2_r, gnuplot_r, gray, gray_r, hot, hot_r, hsv, hsv_r, icefire, icefire_r, inferno, inferno_r, jet, jet_r, magma, magma_r, mako, mako_r, nipy_spectral, nipy_spectral_r, ocean, ocean_r, pink, pink_r, plasma, plasma_r, prism, prism_r, rainbow, rainbow_r, rocket, rocket_r, seismic, seismic_r, spectral, spectral_r, spring, spring_r, summer, summer_r, tab10, tab10_r, tab20, tab20_r, tab20b, tab20b_r, tab20c, tab20c_r, terrain, terrain_r, viridis, viridis_r, vlag, vlag_r, winter, winter_r.

params.label: Drop NA
params.description:
Drop missing values from the data before plotting.
   - Available Options : `True`, `False`

summary.en: This function draws a pairplot using seaborn package.
summary.ko: Seaborn 패키지를 사용하여 pair plot을 그립니다.

md.en:
# Pair Plot This function draws a pairplot using seaborn package. ## Description The pairplot visualizes the distribution of single variable and relationships between two variables. During the process of Exploratory Data Analysis(EDA), a pairplot helps us to find patterns, relationships, or anomalies to inform our subsequent analysis. Reference + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table to draw pairplot. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) A pairplot. #### PARAMETER 1. **X Columns***: Columns to use for the columns of the figure. 2. **Y Columns**: Columns to use for the rows of the figure. If not specified, `X Columns` are chosen by default. 3. **Off Diagonal**: Kind of plot for the non-identity relationships. 4. **Diagonal**: Kind of plot for the diagonal subplots. 5. **Color By**: Columns to map plot aspects to different colors. 6. **Markers**: Either the marker to use for all datapoints or a list of markers with a length the same as the number of levels in the hue variable so that differently colored points will also have different scatterplot markers. 7. **Palette**: Set of colors for mapping the `Color By` variable. Possible values are: Accent, Accent_r, Blues, Blues_r, BrBG, BrBG_r, BuGn, BuGn_r, BuPu, BuPu_r, CMRmap, CMRmap_r, Dark2, Dark2_r, GnBu, GnBu_r, Greens, Greens_r, Greys, Greys_r, OrRd, OrRd_r, Oranges, Oranges_r, PRGn, PRGn_r, Paired, Paired_r, Pastel1, Pastel1_r, Pastel2, Pastel2_r, PiYG, PiYG_r, PuBu, PuBuGn, PuBuGn_r, PuBu_r, PuOr, PuOr_r, PuRd, PuRd_r, Purples, Purples_r, RdBu, RdBu_r, RdGy, RdGy_r, RdPu, RdPu_r, RdYlBu, RdYlBu_r, RdYlGn, RdYlGn_r, Reds, Reds_r, Set1, Set1_r, Set2, Set2_r, Set3, Set3_r, Spectral, Spectral_r, Vega10, Vega10_r, Vega20, Vega20_r, Vega20b, Vega20b_r, Vega20c, Vega20c_r, Wistia, Wistia_r, YlGn, YlGnBu, YlGnBu_r, YlGn_r, YlOrBr, YlOrBr_r, YlOrRd, YlOrRd_r, afmhot, afmhot_r, autumn, autumn_r, binary, binary_r, bone, bone_r, brg, brg_r, bwr, bwr_r, cool, cool_r, coolwarm, coolwarm_r, copper, copper_r, cubehelix, cubehelix_r, flag, flag_r, gist_earth, gist_earth_r, gist_gray, gist_gray_r, gist_heat, gist_heat_r, gist_ncar, gist_ncar_r, gist_rainbow, gist_rainbow_r, gist_stern, gist_stern_r, gist_yarg, gist_yarg_r, gnuplot, gnuplot2, gnuplot2_r, gnuplot_r, gray, gray_r, hot, hot_r, hsv, hsv_r, icefire, icefire_r, inferno, inferno_r, jet, jet_r, magma, magma_r, mako, mako_r, nipy_spectral, nipy_spectral_r, ocean, ocean_r, pink, pink_r, plasma, plasma_r, prism, prism_r, rainbow, rainbow_r, rocket, rocket_r, seismic, seismic_r, spectral, spectral_r, spring, spring_r, summer, summer_r, tab10, tab10_r, tab20, tab20_r, tab20b, tab20b_r, tab20c, tab20c_r, terrain, terrain_r, viridis, viridis_r, vlag, vlag_r, winter, winter_r. 8. **Height**: Height (in inches) of each facet. 9. **Aspect**: `Aspect` * `Height` gives the width (in inches). 10. **Drop NA**: Drop missing values from the data before plotting. 11. **Group By**: Columns to group by. ### Python #### USAGE ``` pairplot(table = , x_vars = , y_vars = , kind = , diag_kind = , hue = , markers = , palette = , height = , aspect = , dropna = , group_by = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table to draw pairplot. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) A pairplot. #### PARAMETER 1. **x_vars***: Columns to use for the columns of the figure. * Type: *list[str]* 2. **y_vars**: Columns to use for the rows of the figure. If not specified, `x_vars` are chosen by default. * Type: *list[str]* 3. **kind**: Kind of plot for the non-identity relationships. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: scatter ( scatter | reg ) 4. **diag_kind**: Kind of plot for the diagonal subplots. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: auto ( auto | hist | kde ) 5. **hue**: Columns to map plot aspects to different colors. * Type: *str* 6. **markers**: Either the marker to use for all datapoints or a list of markers with a length the same as the number of levels in the hue variable so that differently colored points will also have different scatterplot markers. * Type: *list(str)* 7. **palette**: Set of colors for mapping the `palette` variable. Possible values are: Accent, Accent_r, Blues, Blues_r, BrBG, BrBG_r, BuGn, BuGn_r, BuPu, BuPu_r, CMRmap, CMRmap_r, Dark2, Dark2_r, GnBu, GnBu_r, Greens, Greens_r, Greys, Greys_r, OrRd, OrRd_r, Oranges, Oranges_r, PRGn, PRGn_r, Paired, Paired_r, Pastel1, Pastel1_r, Pastel2, Pastel2_r, PiYG, PiYG_r, PuBu, PuBuGn, PuBuGn_r, PuBu_r, PuOr, PuOr_r, PuRd, PuRd_r, Purples, Purples_r, RdBu, RdBu_r, RdGy, RdGy_r, RdPu, RdPu_r, RdYlBu, RdYlBu_r, RdYlGn, RdYlGn_r, Reds, Reds_r, Set1, Set1_r, Set2, Set2_r, Set3, Set3_r, Spectral, Spectral_r, Vega10, Vega10_r, Vega20, Vega20_r, Vega20b, Vega20b_r, Vega20c, Vega20c_r, Wistia, Wistia_r, YlGn, YlGnBu, YlGnBu_r, YlGn_r, YlOrBr, YlOrBr_r, YlOrRd, YlOrRd_r, afmhot, afmhot_r, autumn, autumn_r, binary, binary_r, bone, bone_r, brg, brg_r, bwr, bwr_r, cool, cool_r, coolwarm, coolwarm_r, copper, copper_r, cubehelix, cubehelix_r, flag, flag_r, gist_earth, gist_earth_r, gist_gray, gist_gray_r, gist_heat, gist_heat_r, gist_ncar, gist_ncar_r, gist_rainbow, gist_rainbow_r, gist_stern, gist_stern_r, gist_yarg, gist_yarg_r, gnuplot, gnuplot2, gnuplot2_r, gnuplot_r, gray, gray_r, hot, hot_r, hsv, hsv_r, icefire, icefire_r, inferno, inferno_r, jet, jet_r, magma, magma_r, mako, mako_r, nipy_spectral, nipy_spectral_r, ocean, ocean_r, pink, pink_r, plasma, plasma_r, prism, prism_r, rainbow, rainbow_r, rocket, rocket_r, seismic, seismic_r, spectral, spectral_r, spring, spring_r, summer, summer_r, tab10, tab10_r, tab20, tab20_r, tab20b, tab20b_r, tab20c, tab20c_r, terrain, terrain_r, viridis, viridis_r, vlag, vlag_r, winter, winter_r. * Type: *str* 8. **height**: Height (in inches) of each facet. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 2.5 (value > 0.0) 9. **aspect**: `aspect` * `height` gives the width (in inches). * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 1 (value > 0.0) 10. **dropna**: Drop missing values from the data before plotting. * Type: *boolean* * Default / Range: True 11. **group_by**: Columns to group by. * Type: *list[str]* ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]**
In this tutorial workflow, sample_iris data is used for drawing a pairplot by Pair Plot function. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below. ++Parameters++ 1. **X Columns***: _sepal\_length_, _sepal\_width_ 2. **Y Columns**: _petal\_length_, _petal\_width_ 3. **Off Diagonal**: scatter 4. **Diagonal**: auto 5. **Color By**: _species_ 6. **Markers**: None 7. **Palette**: gist_rainbow 8. **Height**: 2.5 9. **Aspect**: 1 10. **Drop NA**:True ### Python ``` from brightics.function.statistics import pairplot input_table = inputs[0] result = pairplot(table=input_table, x_vars=['sepal_length', 'sepal_width'], y_vars=['petal_length', 'petal_width'], kind='scatter', diag_kind='auto', markers=None, palette='gist_rainbow', height=2.5, aspect=1, dropna=True, hue='species', group_by=None) output = result['result'] ```
In this python script, sample_iris data is used for drawing a pairplot by Pair Plot function.
md.kr:
# 페어 플롯 seaborn 패키지를 이용하여 산점도 행렬 생성 ## Description 산점도 행렬은 한 변수의 분포 및 다른 변수와의 관계를 시각화. 탐색적 데이터 분석(EDA)을 할 때 산점도 행렬은 패턴과 관계, 이상치를 찾는 후속 분석에 도움. Reference + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 산점도 행렬을 그리기 위한 데이터가 들어있는 테이블. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) 산점도 행렬. #### PARAMETER 1. **X Columns***: 산점도 행렬의 열을 이루는 컬럼. 2. **Y Columns**: 산점도 행렬의 행을 이루는 컬럼. 지정하지 않는다면, `X Columns` 가 기본으로 선택. 3. **Off Diagonal**: 서로 동일하지 않은 관계에 있는 컬럼들의 산점도. 4. **Diagonal**: 대각선 위치에 있는 산점도. 5. **Color By**: 다른 색으로 표시하고 싶은 컬럼 지정. 6. **Markers**: 전체의 데이터포인트를 표시하는 표시자 혹은 다른색과 다른 모양으로 표시되는 다른 산점도 표시자들의 리스트. 7. **Palette**: `Color By` 변수로 지정할 수 있는 들의 집합. 가능한 값: Accent, Accent_r, Blues, Blues_r, BrBG, BrBG_r, BuGn, BuGn_r, BuPu, BuPu_r, CMRmap, CMRmap_r, Dark2, Dark2_r, GnBu, GnBu_r, Greens, Greens_r, Greys, Greys_r, OrRd, OrRd_r, Oranges, Oranges_r, PRGn, PRGn_r, Paired, Paired_r, Pastel1, Pastel1_r, Pastel2, Pastel2_r, PiYG, PiYG_r, PuBu, PuBuGn, PuBuGn_r, PuBu_r, PuOr, PuOr_r, PuRd, PuRd_r, Purples, Purples_r, RdBu, RdBu_r, RdGy, RdGy_r, RdPu, RdPu_r, RdYlBu, RdYlBu_r, RdYlGn, RdYlGn_r, Reds, Reds_r, Set1, Set1_r, Set2, Set2_r, Set3, Set3_r, Spectral, Spectral_r, Vega10, Vega10_r, Vega20, Vega20_r, Vega20b, Vega20b_r, Vega20c, Vega20c_r, Wistia, Wistia_r, YlGn, YlGnBu, YlGnBu_r, YlGn_r, YlOrBr, YlOrBr_r, YlOrRd, YlOrRd_r, afmhot, afmhot_r, autumn, autumn_r, binary, binary_r, bone, bone_r, brg, brg_r, bwr, bwr_r, cool, cool_r, coolwarm, coolwarm_r, copper, copper_r, cubehelix, cubehelix_r, flag, flag_r, gist_earth, gist_earth_r, gist_gray, gist_gray_r, gist_heat, gist_heat_r, gist_ncar, gist_ncar_r, gist_rainbow, gist_rainbow_r, gist_stern, gist_stern_r, gist_yarg, gist_yarg_r, gnuplot, gnuplot2, gnuplot2_r, gnuplot_r, gray, gray_r, hot, hot_r, hsv, hsv_r, icefire, icefire_r, inferno, inferno_r, jet, jet_r, magma, magma_r, mako, mako_r, nipy_spectral, nipy_spectral_r, ocean, ocean_r, pink, pink_r, plasma, plasma_r, prism, prism_r, rainbow, rainbow_r, rocket, rocket_r, seismic, seismic_r, spectral, spectral_r, spring, spring_r, summer, summer_r, tab10, tab10_r, tab20, tab20_r, tab20b, tab20b_r, tab20c, tab20c_r, terrain, terrain_r, viridis, viridis_r, vlag, vlag_r, winter, winter_r. 8. **Height**: 각 산점도의 높이.(단위 : 인치) 9. **Aspect**: `Aspect` * `Height` 산점도의 넒이.(단위 : 인치) 10. **Drop NA**: 산점도를 그리기 전 결측치 제거. 11. **Group By**: 그룹을 나누는 컬럼. ### Python #### USAGE ``` pairplot(table = , x_vars = , y_vars = , kind = , diag_kind = , hue = , markers = , palette = , height = , aspect = , dropna = true, group_by = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 산점도 행렬을 그리기 위한 데이터가 들어있는 테이블. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) 산점도 행렬. #### PARAMETER 1. **x_vars***: 산점도 행렬의 열을 이루는 컬럼. * Type: *list[str]* 2. **y_vars**: 산점도 행렬의 행을 이루는 컬럼. 지정하지 않는다면, `x_vars` 가 기본으로 선택. * Type: *list[str]* 3. **kind**: 서로 동일하지 않은 관계에 있는 컬럼들의 산점도. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: scatter ( scatter | reg ) 4. **diag_kind**: 대각선 위치에 있는 산점도. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: auto ( auto | hist | kde ) 5. **hue**: 다른 색으로 표시하고 싶은 컬럼 지정. * Type: *str* 6. **markers**: 전체의 데이터포인트를 표시하는 표시자 혹은 다른색과 다른 모양으로 표시되는 다른 산점도 표시자들의 리스트. * Type: *list(str)* 7. **palette**: `palette`에 설정되어있는 여러 색의 팔레트. 가능한 값: Accent, Accent_r, Blues, Blues_r, BrBG, BrBG_r, BuGn, BuGn_r, BuPu, BuPu_r, CMRmap, CMRmap_r, Dark2, Dark2_r, GnBu, GnBu_r, Greens, Greens_r, Greys, Greys_r, OrRd, OrRd_r, Oranges, Oranges_r, PRGn, PRGn_r, Paired, Paired_r, Pastel1, Pastel1_r, Pastel2, Pastel2_r, PiYG, PiYG_r, PuBu, PuBuGn, PuBuGn_r, PuBu_r, PuOr, PuOr_r, PuRd, PuRd_r, Purples, Purples_r, RdBu, RdBu_r, RdGy, RdGy_r, RdPu, RdPu_r, RdYlBu, RdYlBu_r, RdYlGn, RdYlGn_r, Reds, Reds_r, Set1, Set1_r, Set2, Set2_r, Set3, Set3_r, Spectral, Spectral_r, Vega10, Vega10_r, Vega20, Vega20_r, Vega20b, Vega20b_r, Vega20c, Vega20c_r, Wistia, Wistia_r, YlGn, YlGnBu, YlGnBu_r, YlGn_r, YlOrBr, YlOrBr_r, YlOrRd, YlOrRd_r, afmhot, afmhot_r, autumn, autumn_r, binary, binary_r, bone, bone_r, brg, brg_r, bwr, bwr_r, cool, cool_r, coolwarm, coolwarm_r, copper, copper_r, cubehelix, cubehelix_r, flag, flag_r, gist_earth, gist_earth_r, gist_gray, gist_gray_r, gist_heat, gist_heat_r, gist_ncar, gist_ncar_r, gist_rainbow, gist_rainbow_r, gist_stern, gist_stern_r, gist_yarg, gist_yarg_r, gnuplot, gnuplot2, gnuplot2_r, gnuplot_r, gray, gray_r, hot, hot_r, hsv, hsv_r, icefire, icefire_r, inferno, inferno_r, jet, jet_r, magma, magma_r, mako, mako_r, nipy_spectral, nipy_spectral_r, ocean, ocean_r, pink, pink_r, plasma, plasma_r, prism, prism_r, rainbow, rainbow_r, rocket, rocket_r, seismic, seismic_r, spectral, spectral_r, spring, spring_r, summer, summer_r, tab10, tab10_r, tab20, tab20_r, tab20b, tab20b_r, tab20c, tab20c_r, terrain, terrain_r, viridis, viridis_r, vlag, vlag_r, winter, winter_r. * Type: *str* 8. **height**: 각 산점도의 높이.(단위 : 인치) * Type: *float* * Default / Range: (value > 0.0) 9. **aspect**: `aspect` * `height` 산점도의 넒이.(단위 : 인치) * Type: *float* * Default / Range: (value > 0.0) 10. **dropna**: 산점도를 그리기 전 결측치 제거. * Type: *boolean* * Default / Range: True 11. **group_by**: 그룹을 나누는 컬럼. * Type: *list[str]* ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]**
이 튜토리얼에서는 sample_iris와 Pair Plot 함수를 이용하여 산점도 행렬 생성. 함수에서 매개변수 설정은 아래와 같음. ++Parameters++ 1. **X Columns***: _sepal\_length_, _sepal\_width_ 2. **Y Columns**: _petal\_length_, _petal\_width_ 3. **Off Diagonal**: scatter 4. **Diagonal**: auto 5. **Color By**: _species_ 6. **Markers**: None 7. **Palette**: gist_rainbow 8. **Height**: 2.5 9. **Aspect**: 1 10. **Drop NA**:True ### Python ``` from brightics.function.statistics import pairplot input_table = inputs[0] result = pairplot(table=input_table, x_vars=['sepal_length', 'sepal_width'], y_vars=['petal_length', 'petal_width'], kind='scatter', diag_kind='auto', markers=None, palette='gist_rainbow', height=2.5, aspect=1, dropna=True, hue='species', group_by=None) output = result['result'] ```
위의 파이선 스크립트에서는 sample_iris 데이터와 pairplot 함수를 사용하여 산점도 행렬을 그림.

guide.message: Set data options using Chart Setting Button.
